daily.summary: Mixed precipitation today through Friday, with temperatures rising to 5°C on Tuesday.

data.summary: Light rain starting in the evening.
Light snow (under 1 cm.) starting in the evening.

alerts.title: Special Weather Statement for Hudson, NJ
alerts.description:
A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW STRETCHING WEST TO EAST FROM CENTRAL NEW
JERSEY TO SOUTH OF LONG ISLAND WILL MAY ITS WAY INTO THE AREA OVER
THE NEXT 2 HOURS. SNOWFALL RATES OF 1 TO 2 INCHES PER HOUR AND
VISIBILITIES OF 1/4 MILE OR LESS ARE POSSIBLE WITHIN THIS BAND.

alerts.title: Blizzard Warning for Hudson, NJ
alerts.description:
...NOR`EASTER TO IMPACT THE AREA INTO EARLY SUNDAY MORNING...
...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST SUNDAY...
* LOCATIONS...NEW YORK CITY AND LONG ISLAND IN NEW YORK.
HUDSON...ESSEX AND UNION COUNTIES IN NEW JERSEY.
* HAZARD TYPES...HEAVY SNOW ALONG WITH STRONG AND POTENTIALLY
DAMAGING WINDS. BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW WITH NEAR ZERO
VISIBILITIES EXPECTED SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH THE AFTERNOON
AND INTO THE EVENING.
* ACCUMULATIONS...SNOW ACCUMULATION OF 16 TO 22 INCHES. LESSER
AMOUNTS POSSIBLE ON THE TWIN FORKS OF LONG ISLAND IF RAIN AND
SLEET MIX WITH THE SNOW.
* WINDS...NORTHEAST 30 TO 40 MPH WITH GUSTS UP TO 55 MPH. ISOLATED
HIGHER GUSTS POSSIBLE.
* TEMPERATURES...20S AND LOWER 30S.
* VISIBILITIES...NEAR ZERO AT TIMES.
* TIMING...THROUGH SATURDAY NIGHT.
* IMPACTS...EXTREMELY DANGEROUS TRAVEL DUE TO HEAVY SNOWFALL AND
STRONG WINDS WITH WHITEOUT CONDITIONS LIKELY. SECONDARY AND
TERTIARY ROADS MAY BECOME IMPASSABLE. STRONG WINDS MAY DOWN
POWER LINES AND TREE LIMBS.

alerts.title: Coastal Flood Advisory for Hudson, NJ
alerts.description:
...WIDESPREAD COASTAL FLOODING SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT...
...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 10 AM
EST SATURDAY...
...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM SATURDAY TO
MIDNIGHT EST SATURDAY NIGHT...
* LOCATIONS...COASTAL LOCATIONS ADJACENT TO NEWARK BAY...THE
ARTHUR KILL...AND TIDALLY AFFECTED PORTIONS OF THE HACKENSACK
AND PASSAIC RIVERS..
* TIDAL DEPARTURES...2 1/2 TO 3 FT ABOVE ASTRONOMICAL TIDES
SATURDAY MORNING AND 3 TO 3 1/2 FEET ABOVE NORMAL ASTRONOMICAL
TIDES SATURDAY EVENING.
* TIMING...MINOR COASTAL FLOODING DURING THE SATURDAY MORNING
HIGH TIDE CYCLE AND MODERATE DURING THE SATURDAY EVENING HIGH
TIDE CYCLE.
* IMPACTS...WIDESPREAD FLOODING OF VULNERABLE SHORE ROADS AND/OR
BASEMENTS. LIVES MAY BE AT RISK FOR PEOPLE WHO PUT THEMSELVES
IN HARM/S WAY. ISOLATED STRUCTURAL DAMAGE MAY BE OBSERVED.
...NY HARBOR WATER LEVELS FOR SATURDAY MORNING...
COASTAL............TIME OF......FORECAST TOTAL.....FLOOD.....
LOCATION...........HIGH TIDE.....WATER LEVEL.......CATEGORY..
...................................(MLLW)....................
THE BATTERY NYC.....731 AM.........7.1-7.6.........MINOR.....
BERGEN POINT NY.....730 AM.........7.9-8.4.........MINOR.....
...NY HARBOR WATER LEVELS FOR SATURDAY EVENING...
COASTAL............TIME OF......FORECAST TOTAL.....FLOOD.....
LOCATION...........HIGH TIDE.....WATER LEVEL.......CATEGORY..
...................................(MLLW)....................
THE BATTERY NYC......759 PM.........7.4-7.9........MINOR.....
BERGEN POINT NY......758 PM.........8.2-8.7........MODERATE..

alerts.title: Coastal Flood Advisory for New York, NY
alerts.description:
...WIDESPREAD COASTAL FLOODING SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT...

...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM TO 11 PM
EST SATURDAY...
* LOCATIONS...COASTAL LOCATIONS IN MANHATTAN.

MORNING AND 3 TO 3 1/2 FEET ABOVE NORMAL ASTRONOMICAL TIDES
SATURDAY EVENING.
* TIMING...MINOR COASTAL FLOODING EXPECTED DURING THE SATURDAY
MORNING HIGH TIDE CYCLE. MINOR TO LOCALIZED MODERATE COASTAL
FLOODING POSSIBLE DURING THE SATURDAY EVENING HIGH TIDE CYCLE.
* IMPACTS...FLOODING OF THE MOST VULNERABLE LOCATIONS. MAJORITY
OF ROADS REMAIN PASSABLE WITH ONLY ISOLATED CLOSURES. THERE IS
NO SIGNIFICANT THREAT TO LIFE AND ANY IMPACT ON PROPERTY IS
MINIMAL.

alerts.description:

SATURDAY...
...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM SATURDAY TO
MIDNIGHT EST SATURDAY NIGHT...
* LOCATIONS...COASTAL LOCATIONS ADJACENT TO NEW YORK HARBOR AND
THE ARTHUR KILL.
* TIDAL DEPARTURES...2 1/2 TO 3 FT ABOVE ASTRONOMICAL TIDES
SATURDAY MORNING AND 3 TO 3 1/2 FT ABOVE NORMAL ASTRONOMICAL
TIDES SATURDAY EVENING.
* TIMING...DURING THE TIMES OF HIGH TIDE SATURDAY.
* BEACH EROSION IMPACTS...MINOR BEACH EROSION POSSIBLE DUE TO
ELEVATED WATER LEVELS AND BREAKING WAVES ALONG SOUTH SHORE OF
BROOKLYN AND EAST SHORE OF STATEN ISLAND.
* IMPACTS...MODERATE COASTAL FLOODING. WIDESPREAD FLOODING OF
VULNERABLE SHORE ROADS AND/OR BASEMENTS. LIVES MAY BE AT RISK

alerts.title: Coastal Flood Warning for Queens, NY
alerts.description:
...WIDESPREAD COASTAL FLOODING SATURDAY AND SATURDAY NIGHT...
...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO NOON EST
SATURDAY...
...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM SATURDAY TO
6 PM EST SUNDAY...
...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM SATURDAY TO
MIDNIGHT EST SATURDAY NIGHT...
* LOCATIONS...COASTAL LOCATIONS ADJACENT TO THE SOUTH SHORE OF
NYC...AND WESTERN AND CENTRAL LONG ISLAND.
* TIDAL DEPARTURES...2 1/2 TO 3 FEET ABOVE ASTRONOMICAL TIDES
SATURDAY MORNING AND 3 TO 3 1/2 FEET ABOVE NORMAL ASTRONOMICAL
TIDES SATURDAY EVENING.
* TIMING...DURING THE TIMES OF HIGH TIDE SATURDAY.
* BEACH IMPACTS...ELEVATED WATER LEVELS AND LARGE BREAKING WAVES
ON THE SHORE OF LONG ISLAND MAY RESULT IN EROSION OF DUNES AND
LOCALIZED OVERWASH FOR THE BARRIER BEACHES FROM FIRE ISLAND
AND POINTS WEST SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY.
* COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...MODERATE FLOODING SATURDAY MORNING.
MODERATE TO LOCALIZED MAJOR COASTAL FLOODING SATURDAY EVENING
WITH INUNDATION SEVERE ENOUGH TO CAUSE ISOLATED STRUCTURAL
DAMAGE ALONG WITH WIDESPREAD FLOODING OF VULNERABLE SHORE
ROADS AND PROPERTIES. SEVERAL ROADS WILL LIKELY BE IMPASSABLE.
LIVES MAY BE AT RISK FOR PEOPLE WHO PUT THEMSELVES IN HARM/S
WAY.
...SOUTH SHORE BAYS WATER LEVELS FOR SATURDAY MORNING...
COASTAL............TIME OF......FORECAST TOTAL.......FLOOD.....
LOCATION...........HIGH TIDE.....WATER LEVEL.........CATEGORY..
...................................(MLLW/NGVD).................
